Class TransactionWorkload

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.transaction.TransactionGroup
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.transaction.TransactionWorkload
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITxContainer
public class TransactionWorkload extends TransactionGroup
Represents a workload of transactions, which can be generated either from a file or using a sampler. This class extends TransactionGroup and provides methods to add and manage transactions.
Author:
Sotirios Liaskos, Nahid Alimohammadi
See Also:

      public TransactionWorkload(Sampler sampler)
      Constructs a TransactionWorkload with the given sampler.

    • TransactionWorkload

      public TransactionWorkload(String fileName, boolean hasHeader) throws Exception
      See TransactionGroup(String, boolean)
      Parameters:
      fileName - The workload filename to be read.
      hasHeader - Whether the file has a header.
      Throws:
      Exception - Generic IO exception.

  • Method Details

    • appendTransactions

      public void appendTransactions(long num) throws Exception
      Appends a specified number of transactions after the last transaction in the workload.
      Parameters:
      num - The number of transactions to append.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - If the number of transactions is less than 0.
      Exception

    • addTransaction

      Adds a transaction with the given current time.
      Parameters:
      currTime - The current time of the transaction.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • pickRandomTransactions

      public ArrayList<Transaction> pickRandomTransactions(int transNo, float percentile)
      Picks a specified number of random transactions from the workload based on the given percentile value.
      Parameters:
      transNo - The number of transactions to pick.
      percentile - The percentile value to determine the range for picking transactions. For example from 100 transactions with indexes 1..100, percentile 0.25 will return samples from the first 25 transactions (indexes 1..25)
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of randomly picked transactions possibly with duplicates.

    • updateConflicts

      public void updateConflicts(TxConflictRegistry reg, double dispersion, double likelihood)
      Updates the given TxConflictRegistry with conflicts based on the specified dispersion and likelihood.
      Parameters:
      reg - The TxConflictRegistry to be updated.
      dispersion - The dispersion parameter controlling the closeness of conflicts. In [0,1].
      likelihood - The likelihood of a transaction having a conflict. In [0,1]
